labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.95-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): FS session ## Action Performed: 1. Create a _Control_ workspace 2. Go to Members > Invite member 3. Select a user > Next ## Expected Result: - Add the Approver row on the confirm details page. Set the entered user as the invitee's submitsTo. Notes: - The row should be populated by default with the workspace's default approver. - It should only appear on `Control` workspaces, because `Collect` workspaces use a single approver for all. - It should only appear when advanced approvals are enabled on the Control workspace, because basic approvals uses a single approver for all. - The members that appear in the select list should follow the same logic as exists in Workflows, no changes there. ## Actual Result: There isn't an Approver field as it stands. ## Workaround: N/A ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. title: [$250] Add sticky filters to the reports page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1767893350163039 We have three main queries for the reports page: - Expenses - Reports - Chats Each of these presets is currently a pre-defined query (IE `type:expense`, `type:expense-report`, etc), which we navigate to when the item is clicked. We want to make each of these presets have a sort of internal-state, allowing the user to navigate away from that preset, and then back to it, while preserving the selected filters. See the example below: - User clicks `Reports > Reports` - User filters by date, and user, while on the reports page - User clicks `Expenses` and gets taken to the expenses view - User changes some filters on the expenses page - User navigates back to the `Reports` Page - The filters on the reports page should be the same as before: date & user

  • Last Price Increase: 2026-01-08

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.95-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176694/test-cases/41236764 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOs 26.1 Safari **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND with a new gmail account 2. Create a workspace 3. Navigate to Workflows - Payments and add bank account (Plaid 1111) 4. Open Payment settings, click on bank account and disconnect 5. Click "Add bank account" again 6. on the "Choose any existing BA..." RHP click on the previously connected BA push row ## Expected Result: Confirmation RHP is opened on the right side of the page, the bank account is shown on Payments after reconnecting ## Actual Result: "Connect bank account" RHP is not opened, user is dropped on the Workflows page. Payment section still shows "Add bank account". BA finally appears in Payment section after refreshing the page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/94587e88-82a5-41bc-81c0-ede250ef6dc5 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.95-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78765 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon+yydyd373@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Login as new account 3. Tap to the "Reports" tab 4. Go offline 5. Click on "Create expense" 6. Tap on "Manual" 7. Add an amount and tap on "Next" 8. In Choose recipient page, select "Manager McTest" 9. Create and open the expense 10. Verify that the Marked as paid system message appears, header shows outstanding status, and report shows manager owes amount 11. Delete the expense 12. Open Manager McTest, create an expense 13. Note paid status is shown 14. Open the expense 15. Note expense preview is not shown, total and mark as paid message is shown 16. Go online 17. Open the expense and note report shows expense preview and report as IOU ## Expected Result: Manager McTest expense created from report shows and from direct chat must shows same status. Opening expense created from direct chat must show expense preview in offline. ## Actual Result: Manager McTest expense created from report shows status "outstanding" and from direct chat shows "paid". Opening expense created from direct chat is not showing expense preview in offline. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1c223333-f990-419f-be8a-e07d2fe2817a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
